"What If I refuse?", Karen asked, not wanting to deal with another situation as with the Troll.

"Then I leave you to hang here", He replied with a dark smirk," Who knows what might come to get a defenseless pretty little thing like you".

Karen frowned, knowing that another monster might show up, yet on the other hand who knows what this creepy Man would do to her.

"Fine", Karen agreed, figuring whatever this guy would do to her couldn't be anywhere as bad as what one of the Monsters would do," Just get me down".

"Alright", The Woodsman replied, licking his lips as he pulled out a pair of cuffs," Just put your arms behind your back, gotta make sure you don't try something".

Karen sighed, moving her hands to her back, causing her panties to show again much to her embarrassment. The Woodman merely stared up at them, looking at her hungrily as he cuffed her.

Suddenly thrusting her face closer to Karens, she says, "ah, you, the legend, you must be the person from the legend that will help us!" she finally manages to say after stuttering for a while. "You must come with me! There is someone you have to meet!" She says as pulls on Karens arm.

Does she go with her?

111211211111111111111111211211.content:

Clasping her hands together, she says, "oh great! come, follow me!" The naga says as she heads to the left of where Karen was suppose to go.

Now walking side by side with a naga, Karen can't help but feel a bit awkward by this. Noticing that she was acting weird, the naga says, "are you ok? Your acting a bit weird". "Huh? Oh its nothing, its just that I would never have guessed that I would ever meet a naga, let alone be traveling with one".

"I see, well at least it was me you met and not one of the rogue ones out there" the naga says back to her. "Huh? rogue? what do you mean?" Karen asks, curious by her response.

"Well, it will take a bit to explain, but we do have a ways until the village, I just came to that clearing to pick a few apples. Well then I'll start".

"Well, it all started hundreds of years ago, when us nagas and you humans were at war with each other". "War, really?". "Yes, our ancestors use to hunt and eat you humans". "Uhh, I see," Karen says with a worried look on her face. "But that was a long time ago, you see, we realized that it was too much effort to hunt you kind, though how you taste is amazing, when we could just go into the forest and find things that were bigger and easier to hunt. And over time, we formed a sort of alliance with the humans, agreeing not to attack each other anymore". "Well, at least it ended well," Karen said with a slight smile on her face.

"Oh, but I am not done yet". "Oh, sorry, please continue". "Alright, about a hundred years after we stopped hunting your kind, one of your magic users created a certain potion. Yes that,.....immortality potion?, you know, the one that prevents us from dying or experiencing any serious pain. Well, when he created that potion, we started eating humans again". Surprised from this, Karen jumps back a bit. With a smile on her face, she starts talking again. "Heh, I expected that reaction, you see it started slow, only a few in the various naga villages started this again, they would eat a human, each experiencing an unimaginable pleasure, then the human would be restored at an important place, thanks to the potion, so eventually, all nagas started eating humans again, since neither of us has to worry about death. And this is where rogues come in, you see, us naga never eat people without there consent, we consider that wrong, but these rogue naga, they ignore this, they hate humans for whatever reason and do not abide by the rules that we have of eating your kind," she says finishing up her long story. "Well, at least all that is in the past now, and your not a rogue naga, so there is nothing to worry about," Karen says as they smile at each other.

"Oh, by the way, my name is Karen," Karen says, extending her right hand, pausing for a moment, she grabs it and says, "Karen huh, well, my name is Lilsti". With greetings now out of the way, they continue towards Lilsti's home.
111211211111111111111111211211.title: Lilsti, history, and rogues.

11121121111111111111111121121121.content:
Making their way to Lilsti's village, Karen cant help but feel like something is watching her. She has felt this way a little after they left the apple trees, and she cant stop looking behind her.

With one final look behind her, she finally notices something, she could not see what it was, but she saw a shadow on the ground go behind a tree. Now knowing that something is following them, she stops and turns around, trying to figure out what it was.

Lilsti notices her stopping and turning around and asks, "whats wrong? why did you stop?" Slightly turning her head towards Lilsti, she responds, "something is following us, I just saw something go behind those trees". "I see, well then, lets see what is following us," Lilsti says as she grabs a large log with her tail and throws it where Karen saw the shadow.

The log soars through the air and crashes into the forest, forcing the shadow out into the open.

It was Karen's old friend, a latch worm. With a loud scream, she ducks behind Lilsti, as her previous experience with them runs through her head.

"...From your scream, I guess you've seen these things before," Lilsti says, "...y-yes, I hate these Latch worms". "You know what there called?" "You mean there actually called that? The name just suddenly popped into my head",
" I see, well you are suppose to be this hero, who knows what your capable of," Lilsti says as she raises her tail and smashes the worm.

"Damn, now were surrounded," Lilsti says. Karen picks up a large stick and gets ready to defend herself. Lilsti pulls her tail in, away from the worms and Karen moves right next to her, ready for them to attack.

Some of the Latch worms start to close in, using this chance, Lilsti takes off. With the speed and agility of a naga, she quickly makes her way around the forest, taking out worm after worm.

Karen wasn't doing so bad herself, with her large stick, she was taking out a lot of worms too. Completely fixed on what was going on around her, she did not notice what was going on with Lilsti.

She had taken out most of the worms, but was overconfident, to her these were easy prey, a lot slower than her and nowhere near as agile. She was paying too much attention on what was going on in front of her that she did not see the few behind her attatch themselves to her.

Karen opens her eyes and lays there for a moment.

The banging noise happens a 5th time. It's definitely coming from the kitchen, but there is no one there. He eventually finds the source, it's coming from a pantry. "One of the maids probably just poorly packed something in there and it's hitting the door", he tells himself.

He opens the pantry door, and everything goes black.

Waking up, he gets to his feet, a hand on his head. "Ugh, what happened? What the hell? Where am I?".

There were trees surrounding him, somehow, he had ended up in a forest. He knew he wasn't on his property, and he starts to think of how he ended up here. "Kidnapping? An experiment backfired?", he comes up with many theories, though he can't prove anything.

"I guess it doesn't matter. I just need to find a way out of here". Looking up at the sun, he sees that it is close to noon, and he decides to head north.
1141.title: Unknown forest.

11411.content:

Getting back to his feet, he suddenly hears growling directly behind him. A large blue wolf was just coming out of the forest. "A blue wolf? A new species? Or was it bred like that?", he couldn't help it, his curiosity getting the best of him. He notices it's posture. "If it's anything like the wolves I've studied, it's getting ready to pounce", he thinks, and it does. He sidesteps it, and it falls in the river. "Too predictable". It quickly turns around, but Nathan was ready. It leaps again, only to be met by a well timed kick to it's lower jaw. It hits the ground, and Nathan is immediately on it, lifting a large rock in one hand he picked up from the stream's edge, he smashed it into the beast's head. He does this a few more times, making sure he killed it.

After confirming his kill, he starts to examine it. "What a waste, this would have made an excellent specimen. But, it is a wolf in every way. It was just larger than most wolves and had an odd colored coat. But, I can safely assume I'm not near my house anymore".

His attention is redirected behind him, he hears more movement in the direction the wolf came from.

He turns around and gets another surprise. "You killed it? Darn, I had been tracking that creature for a while now".

A girl with long brown hair and blue eyes entered the clearing. She looked to be around his age, and she had a great figure, but this is not what surprised him. Everything below her stomach, was a horse. She was a centauress, with her lower horse half a light brown color and a brown tail.

He is at a loss for words. Standing before him is a living myth, something that shouldn't exist. His curiosity takes control again. He walks up to her side and puts his hand against her, it was warm, she was real.

Embarrassed, "wh-what are you doing!". "Amazing! A real centaur, I mean centauress. I never thought that they existed, or that I'd even meet one!", talking to himself, as he continues to examine her side. Still surprised, she pushes him away from her. "What is your problem! Don't touch me!".

"Huh? Oh! I'm sorry. I let my curiosity get the better of me". Still a bit upset, she realizes something. "Wait, what do you mean by saying we don't exist?".

He explains, in detail, all he knows about centaurs.

"I thought the entire world knew about us. Wait, I know as a fact that we're known. Unless, what is the name of your world?". He's confused by this. "What an odd question. Earth of course".

"But this isn't Earth. It's Rolarik. That can only mean that you came from another world! Is that legend true". He looks even more confused, "what are you talking about?". She begins to tell him.

"I always thought it was just a legend, something that people thought up to give them hope, or something like that. But with what you just told me, there is no way your from this world, and that would explain your clothing.....But as I was saying. This is Rolarik, there is a legend that says that when we're in trouble, a person from another world will come to help us. I guess that's you".

"Hmmm, you seem to be telling the truth, and I've never heard of real centaurs or blue wolves. So I guess I can believe you. So, what am I suppose to save you all from?".

"From a so called warlord. He was born with large magical powers and is able to summon massive armies using his powers. He uses these armies to overwhelm his opponents and take over one place at a time". "And I'm suppose to stop this "magic" user". "Yes". "Where is he? I must see him first before I formulate a plan". "I don't know, he is constantly on the move. You will have to ask the closest human town. Fortunately, there is one a few days from here. I can take you part of the way".

"Would you stop that", she sounds very annoyed. "Sorry, I can't help it, I am a scientist. Right, by the way, what is your name? Mine is Nathan".

"Willow". "Oh...named after a tree". "You know that?". "I am a genius, I know a lot of things".

Slowly Alex awakens, sand grains in his eyes and mouth. Spitting harshly he sits up and stares.

"What the... hell...."

Gazing around all he sees is sand for miles around, though there are quite a few high dunes. Then he notices shards of glass nearby, half buried by sand. Reaching down he picks some up, to find it's the remains of a glass ball, shattered into large pieces. There are dozens all around him... then he remembers the bright lights. Are these the remains of those lights in his room? What is going on?

The sun is low in the sky and he thinks it's a little lower than when he first woke up. And deserts are cold at night! He's wearing Pajamas, not very warming! Struggling to his bare feet in the stark landscape he stares around in panic, starting to shiver, even though it isn't cold now. Fear is starting to seep into his bones.

One direction seems the same as another here, though there is a large dune nearby. Maybe from there he can see over the other dunes. With luck there is shelter near here.

It's a struggle to keep upright with sand shifting beneath his feet. Sand has got into his PJs and they itch like mad, but still he shivers in the heat, fearing what will happen at sundown. Every now and then he half heartedly shouts out to see if anyone can hear him, but there is no response. Maybe an hour later, the sun dipping close to the horizon, he crests the sandy ridge and stares over the top.
134.title: A desert.

choices: His stomach starts twisting and gurgling. What did he drink? It's MOVING!
A shadow falls on him. Someone is staring at him from the river.
A noise from the river catches his attention. Fish? Maybe, but sounds odd.
1342.content:
It's downhill all the way, and Alex stumbles and trips down the dune, then across the flats towards the foliage. It's like a long thin oasis stretched out before him, and he wonders why there isn't more here. Maybe the river isn't always flowing? Maybe the trees and bushes only grow at some times of the year.

After over an hour of stumbling from the tall sand dune he reaches the shade, and shortly after the river. Falling to his knees his parched lips plunge into cool, clear water.

"Oh god! Water never tasted so good!" he gasps, rolling on his back a few minutes later. Maybe he over did the drinking a bit there, but he was soo thirsty!
1342.title: The River.

13421.content:
Grunting Alex sits up, clutching his churning stomach. It is way bloated, he drank an awful lot, but this is... Gaping he stares. It doesn't just feel like it's churning he can SEE it shifting! His belly flesh writhes, his swollen tummy making bulges and odd shapes as it's contents swirl and splash around inside him.

"Ungh, what is this?" he gasps... and suddenly the shaking and thrashing stops inside him.

"What?" comes a high pitched voice... from inside his stomach! "W... who is that? What is that? Did you eat me?"

Alex eyes bug out even further, if that was possible, as he stares at his full stomach. He gulps, the shakes coming back to him. Slowly he tries to think of something to say.

"Er, Hi. I'm.... Alex." he says carefully. "I... guess I ate you. Um, sorry? I have no idea how. How small are you? Are you drowning in there?"

There is a pause before the voice answers.

"I've never heard of a person being able to do that! I mean, animals sure... but people? How do you keep stuff inside you? Oh, I'm only twenty Cycles old, so not that big. A couple of arms at most."

Arms?

"OK, I guess, first things first. How do I get you out without hurting me or you?"

"I don't know! I thought you knew? If I eat something that I don't want to keep I just let it drop out. This feels way too hard to do that though... you're not a person are you? What are you?"

Not a person? Oh, maybe they call their race 'people'?

"My people call themselves Humans. I... can try to throw up but can you promise to be gentle coming out? If you thrash as you come up... it could seriously hurt me!"

Again a pause.

"OK. So, you're gonna let me out? Um, now?"

"Yeah, I'm really sorry about this. This might be tight for you. Hang on."

Sticking his finger down his throat took a couple of goes, then... *HURK!*

The rest was as expected, and the... girl? Inside him did manage to avoid thrashing as she came up... in a torrent! Water poured from Alex's lips, along with his last meal, what was left of it, but the water pooled on the ground and slowly formed a shape as poured... PULLED itself out of him! With a grunt he felt the last bit slosh out of his mouth and there below him was a girl... made of water, barely a foot tall! Blinking she stared up at Alex in shock.

"Y.. y... your a Leng! That's not possible! And, such a big one!" She paused, blinking. "So, do you just get smarter when you get bigger? I've never heard of a Leng being able to talk!"

"Um, I don't know what a Leng is, but I'm human. We talk when we're young, though it takes a while for it make much sense. Maybe a third my height."

"Hmm, that sounds smaller than any Leng I've seen. Most are about half your height, maybe a bit taller." Three foot tall, Alex translated to himself. "But no Leng has ever talked! They are just... well, animals."

Alex smiles and reaches a hand down to the tiny... naked girl. He blushes as he realizes she seems a perfect, if tiny, replica of an adult woman... in every detail! She grasps a finger with both hands and pulls herself upright, apparently tired by her ordeal. Alex frowns as he sees bits of the Pizza he ate for dinner floating inside her! OK, Ick!

"I... I'm Slen'va." she says, peering up at Alex.

"Alex. Pleased to eat you... I mean meet you." He says. OK, Freudian slip! She actually giggled, if a little nervously.

"Pleased to be eaten... er, sort of." She says as she stands to her full height of maybe a foot and a half tall "Anyway, thanks for throwing me up! You're definitely not a Leng, Heh!"

"Well, if I remember right there's a Leng just down the river a little ways, at least I saw one when I was swimming up here before you, er, took a drink."

"That's a Leng." Slen'va says five minutes later, pointing to a small form crouched by the stream "Female obviously, though most are female. Not sure the ratio off hand."

Her long brown hair was a bit bedraggled, and there were some ingrained mud stains on her face, but otherwise she was stunning. Clean, smooth skin. large breasts (for her size). Hour-glass shape. Long legs. Perfect heart shaped butt. If Slen'va hadn't said they were animals Alex would be in love. She seemed to be washing herself and catching fish while nervously looking around.

Alex and Slen'va were crouched behind some bushes, peeking out at the girl... er... creature. It was hard not to think of it as a girl!

"You're right. I DO look like a Leng!" Alex said quietly "Though no where near as cute as that!"
